title: 'Matt Gaetz college roommate' rumor resurfaces on X after Trump names him as attorney general
content: Apart from a sex trafficking case, Matt Gaetz was linked to the unnatural death of his roommate at Florida State University but the case was ruled as a suicide. Now that he has been named as the attorney general, the rumor resurfaced on social media. Republican leaders are certain that Gaetz won't get confirmed by the Senate. Gaetz needs a Senate majority to become the attorney general.
summary: Apart from a sex trafficking case, Matt Gaetz was linked to the unnatural death of his roommate at Florida State University but the case was ruled as a suicide. Now that he has been named as the attorney general, the rumor resurfaced on social media. Republican leaders are certain that Gaetz won't get confirmed by the Senate. Gaetz needs a Senate majority to become the attorney general.

title: Police find up to 20 human skulls in New Mexico residence, link one to missing woman
content: Police in New Mexico made a chilling discovery of up to 20 human skulls in a home in Jal, potentially linked to the 2019 disappearance of Angela McManes. The investigation began when a resident reported a disturbing encounter with Cecil Villanueva, who allegedly discarded bags containing human bones.
summary: Police in New Mexico made a chilling discovery of up to 20 human skulls in a home in Jal, potentially linked to the 2019 disappearance of Angela McManes. The investigation began when a resident reported a disturbing encounter with Cecil Villanueva, who allegedly discarded bags containing human bones.

title: From Elon Musk to Tulsi Gabbard: One fun fact about each member of Team Trump 2024
content: Imagine if Ray Clay, the voice that ignited the Chicago arena, were to announce the newest Team Trump 2024 line-up. Close your eyes and let Sirius by The Alan Parsons Project echo in the background. It’s 2024, and the air is thick with MAGA fever. Each pick is making Washington pundits go redder. There’s the former news anchor who is now head of Pentagon. There’s a new department that sounds like a Yes Minister spoof with two billionaires in-charge. There’s Secretary of Homeland Security who shot her own dog and one guy who everyone confuses with an iconic rock band.
summary: Imagine if Ray Clay, the voice that ignited the Chicago arena, were to announce the newest Team Trump 2024 line-up. Close your eyes and let Sirius by The Alan Parsons Project echo in the background. It’s 2024, and the air is thick with MAGA fever. Each pick is making Washington pundits go redder. There’s the former news anchor who is now head of Pentagon. There’s a new department that sounds like a Yes Minister spoof with two billionaires in-charge. There’s Secretary of Homeland Security who shot her own dog and one guy who everyone confuses with an iconic rock band.

title: 'Trump is targeting bottom line': Israel expects new US administration to take hard line on Iran
content: Israel anticipates the new Trump administration will take a tough stance against Iran, potentially paving the way for peace agreements with Arab nations. Energy Minister Eli Cohen expressed optimism that Trump's return could lead to a resolution in Lebanon, pushing Hezbollah away from the border, while emphasizing Israel's right to military action if necessary.
summary: Israel anticipates the new Trump administration will take a tough stance against Iran, potentially paving the way for peace agreements with Arab nations. Energy Minister Eli Cohen expressed optimism that Trump's return could lead to a resolution in Lebanon, pushing Hezbollah away from the border, while emphasizing Israel's right to military action if necessary.

title: Trump fallout? CNN set to fire hundreds of employees after dismal ratings during election coverage
content: Over the years, Donald Trump has been relentless in his public criticisms of CNN, often using the network as a punching bag in his ongoing battle against mainstream media. He coined the term “fake news” largely in reference to CNN, frequently accusing the network of bias and suggesting that it was part of a “media conspiracy” against him and his supporters.
summary: Over the years, Donald Trump has been relentless in his public criticisms of CNN, often using the network as a punching bag in his ongoing battle against mainstream media. He coined the term “fake news” largely in reference to CNN, frequently accusing the network of bias and suggesting that it was part of a “media conspiracy” against him and his supporters.

title: Eva Longoria says she is moving out of 'dystopian' US because Kamala Harris didn't win
content: “The shocking part is not that he won,” Longoria told Marie Claire in an interview for its November cover story conducted two days after Trump triumphed in the presidential race. “It’s that a convicted criminal who spews so much hate could hold the highest office,” Longoria explained and admitted her privilege that she could move to another country unlike most Americans.
summary: “The shocking part is not that he won,” Longoria told Marie Claire in an interview for its November cover story conducted two days after Trump triumphed in the presidential race. “It’s that a convicted criminal who spews so much hate could hold the highest office,” Longoria explained and admitted her privilege that she could move to another country unlike most Americans.

title: Russian chef Alexei Zimin, known for anti-war stance, found dead in Belgrade apartment
content: Renowned Russian chef and vocal critic of the Ukraine war, Alexei Zimin, was found dead in his Belgrade apartment. Zimin, who had been residing in London, was visiting Serbia to promote his latest book. While the circumstances surrounding his death are not considered suspicious, an autopsy is scheduled.
summary: Renowned Russian chef and vocal critic of the Ukraine war, Alexei Zimin, was found dead in his Belgrade apartment. Zimin, who had been residing in London, was visiting Serbia to promote his latest book. While the circumstances surrounding his death are not considered suspicious, an autopsy is scheduled.

title: Melania likes 'First Buddy' Elon Musk, Trump's inner circle feeling iced out
content: Elon Musk has become a close confidant of President-elect Donald Trump, frequently seen at Mar-a-Lago. This newfound friendship has reportedly shifted the dynamics within Trump's inner circle, with some old-timers feeling sidelined but First Lady to-be Melania Trump is approving of Elon Musk's proximity to her husband and she is believed to be a fan of the Tesla CEO.
summary: Elon Musk has become a close confidant of President-elect Donald Trump, frequently seen at Mar-a-Lago. This newfound friendship has reportedly shifted the dynamics within Trump's inner circle, with some old-timers feeling sidelined but First Lady to-be Melania Trump is approving of Elon Musk's proximity to her husband and she is believed to be a fan of the Tesla CEO.

title: The Onion acquires Alex Jones' Infowars in bankruptcy auction
content: The Onion, a satirical publication, has successfully acquired Infowars, the website founded by conspiracy theorist Alex Jones, in a bankruptcy auction. The acquisition, supported by families of the Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting victims, aims to transform Infowars into a parody of itself, satirizing misinformation and online personalities.
summary: The Onion, a satirical publication, has successfully acquired Infowars, the website founded by conspiracy theorist Alex Jones, in a bankruptcy auction. The acquisition, supported by families of the Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting victims, aims to transform Infowars into a parody of itself, satirizing misinformation and online personalities.

title: FBI raids Polymarket CEO Shayne Coplan's home days after platform accurately predicted Trump's win
content: The FBI searched the Manhattan apartment of Shayne Coplan, CEO of prediction market platform Polymarket, as part of an investigation into whether the platform operated as an unlicensed commodities exchange. The investigation centers around Polymarket's allowance of US users to place bets, potentially violating a previous settlement with the US government.
summary: The FBI searched the Manhattan apartment of Shayne Coplan, CEO of prediction market platform Polymarket, as part of an investigation into whether the platform operated as an unlicensed commodities exchange. The investigation centers around Polymarket's allowance of US users to place bets, potentially violating a previous settlement with the US government.

title: Greece in talks with Israel to develop 2 billion euro 'Iron Dome'
When Tulsi Gabbard clarified her nationality: 'I am not of Indian origin'
content: ​Tulsi Gabbard's mother Carol Porter Gabbard was raised in a multicultural household and became interested in Hinduism. All her children have Hindu names -- Bhakti, Jai, Aryan, Tulsi and Vrindavan. Tulsi also follows Hinduism. Old Videos of Tulsi chanting Hare Krishna are viral after she became the first Hindu to head US spy agencies.
summary: ​Tulsi Gabbard's mother Carol Porter Gabbard was raised in a multicultural household and became interested in Hinduism. All her children have Hindu names -- Bhakti, Jai, Aryan, Tulsi and Vrindavan. Tulsi also follows Hinduism. Old Videos of Tulsi chanting Hare Krishna are viral after she became the first Hindu to head US spy agencies.

title: EU fines Meta nearly €800 million for 'abusive' practices benefiting Facebook marketplace
content: The European Commission has slapped Meta with a hefty €797.72 million fine for allegedly giving Facebook Marketplace an unfair advantage. Regulators claim Meta forced the service on users and leveraged data from advertisers to stifle competition. Meta denies any wrongdoing, arguing that users aren't forced to use Marketplace and that its success stems from meeting consumer demand.
summary: The European Commission has slapped Meta with a hefty €797.72 million fine for allegedly giving Facebook Marketplace an unfair advantage. Regulators claim Meta forced the service on users and leveraged data from advertisers to stifle competition. Meta denies any wrongdoing, arguing that users aren't forced to use Marketplace and that its success stems from meeting consumer demand.

title: Monkey Island, cat research: Vivek Ramaswamy reacts to cost-cutting suggestions, 'If it doesn't....'
content: Vivek Ramaswamy reacted to a list of unnecessary government expenditures that included $33 million of government expenditure to run 'Monkey Island' in South Carolina; $549K to a Russian lab performing experiments on cats' brains and said if something does not advance the interests of American citizen, it has to go.
summary: Vivek Ramaswamy reacted to a list of unnecessary government expenditures that included $33 million of government expenditure to run 'Monkey Island' in South Carolina; $549K to a Russian lab performing experiments on cats' brains and said if something does not advance the interests of American citizen, it has to go.

title: Watch: Moment when Elon Musk raises hand as 'George Soros of the Right'
content: ​Poles apart on politics, Musk accused Soros of trying to destroy Western civilization. Musk said Soros has been using his fortune to control narratives, shape public opinion and push his own political agenda. Musk said Soros funds progressive causes and media outlets to steer society away from open debate and true freedom.
summary: ​Poles apart on politics, Musk accused Soros of trying to destroy Western civilization. Musk said Soros has been using his fortune to control narratives, shape public opinion and push his own political agenda. Musk said Soros funds progressive causes and media outlets to steer society away from open debate and true freedom.

title: 7 killed after car bomb accidently explodes in a former stronghold of the Pakistani Taliban
'Sex in Michelle's bathroom': Book claims Secret Service agent invited lover to Obamas' Hawaii mansion
content: A self-published author alleged that a Secret Service agent, tasked with protecting the Obamas, brought her to their Hawaiian residence without authorization in 2022. The agent, later fired after an internal investigation, reportedly suggested they engage in sex in Michelle Obama's bathroom. The author revealed that she contacted with the agent's boss and told them about his double life.
summary: A self-published author alleged that a Secret Service agent, tasked with protecting the Obamas, brought her to their Hawaiian residence without authorization in 2022. The agent, later fired after an internal investigation, reportedly suggested they engage in sex in Michelle Obama's bathroom. The author revealed that she contacted with the agent's boss and told them about his double life.

title: Lahore reports over 15,000 respiratory cases in one day due to toxic haze, Nasa shares smog photo
content: Lahore, Pakistan, is grappling with hazardous smog, recording a pollution index of 1165. Hospitals are overwhelmed with respiratory illness cases, exceeding 15,000 in a day. The severe air pollution, attributed to industrial emissions and other factors, has prompted school closures, outdoor activity bans, and emergency measures by authorities.
summary: Lahore, Pakistan, is grappling with hazardous smog, recording a pollution index of 1165. Hospitals are overwhelmed with respiratory illness cases, exceeding 15,000 in a day.  The severe air pollution, attributed to industrial emissions and other factors, has prompted school closures, outdoor activity bans, and emergency measures by authorities.

title: COP29 host Azerbaijan says doors 'still open' after spat with France
Sri Lanka snap elections: What’s at stake for the island nation dealing with economic crisis
content: Sri Lankans are voting in a parliamentary election that could give President Anura Kumara Dissanayake the mandate to implement his reform agenda as the country seeks to recover from a crippling economic crisis. Dissanayake's left-leaning party is vying for a majority against a fractured opposition, with the outcome holding significant implications for Sri Lanka's economic policies and international relations.
summary: Sri Lankans are voting in a parliamentary election that could give President Anura Kumara Dissanayake the mandate to implement his reform agenda as the country seeks to recover from a crippling economic crisis. Dissanayake's left-leaning party is vying for a majority against a fractured opposition, with the outcome holding significant implications for Sri Lanka's economic policies and international relations.
